actions.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Transportation. H. Rept. 106-58.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 24.
Mr. Franks moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 44.
On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.

official_title: Authorizing the use of the Capitol Grounds for the 18th annual National Peace Officers' Memorial Service.

summary.text: Permits the National Fraternal Order of Police and its auxiliary to sponsor a free, public event, the 17th annual National Peace Officers' Memorial Service, on the Capitol grounds on May 15, 1999. Requires the Capitol Police Board to provide for enforcement of the restrictions contained in Federal law provisions concerning sales, displays, and solicitations on the Capitol grounds, as well as other restrictions applicable to the Capitol grounds, with respect to such event.

titles.title: Authorizing the use of the Capitol Grounds for the 18th annual National Peace Officers' Memorial Service.
